verbose_text: Furthermore, the results of RT-qPCR revealed that the inductive effect of N-Ac-PGP treatment for 3 days on the expression of CCL2, CCL5, IL-6, CXCL10, MMP3, MMP13, ADAMTS4 and ADAMTS5 in NP cells was retarded by the specific signaling inhibitors (XREF_FIG), suggesting that the pro inflammatory and matrix catabolic effect of N-Ac-PGP on NP cells is mediated by the activation of NF-kappaB and MAPK signaling pathways at the early stage of N-Ac-PGP treatment.
evidence: matrix catabolic effect of N-Ac-PGP on NP cells is mediated by the activation of NF-kappaB and MAPK
